article.description: Dirk Nowitzki scored 27 points, and his three-point play with 6.9 seconds left gave the Dallas Mavericks a 95-94 victory over the Denver Nuggets on Tuesday night.
article.headline: Nowitzki scores 14 in fourth, including game-winner

images.name: Nowitzky_Dirk 010802 inline
images.caption: Dirk Nowitzki reacts after scoring in the final seconds to lift the Mavericks to victory.

article.linkText: Nowitzki's late heroics give Mavs 95-94 win over Nuggets
article.story:
DALLAS (AP) -- With Michael Finley on the injured list, Dirk Nowitzki led the way for the Dallas Mavericks. Nowitzki scored 27 points, and his three-point play with 6.9 seconds left gave the Mavericks a 95-94 victory over the Nuggets on Tuesday night, Denver's fifth straight loss. Avery Johnson's layup with 19.7 seconds remaining had given Denver a 94-92 lead. But Nowitzki spun into the lane, pump-faked, and shot a 12-foot turnaround jumper that rolled around the rim before falling in. He was fouled by Ryan Bowen and made the free throw to put Dallas ahead for good. "In that situation, Mike (Finley) usually gets the ball," Nowitzki said. "But he's not here so they called a post-up play for me. I knew I had to get to the middle, give a fake and get the ball up there. We were lucky to win the game." Finley, second to Nowitzki on the Mavs in scoring with a 20.1-point average, went on the injured list for the first time in his six-year career before the game. He has a strained left hamstring. Nick Van Exel, who paced Denver with 31 points, fired an air ball on a 3-point attempt with 2 seconds left, and Dallas' Eduardo Najera came away with the rebound as time expired. "We got the ball where we wanted there at the end," Denver coach Mike Evans said. "It was perfect, except for the finish." Raef LaFrentz added 24 points and 11 rebounds for the Nuggets, who trailed by as many as 16 in the third quarter. Denver has lost nine of its last 10 games. Juwan Howard added 15 points and nine rebounds for the Mavericks, who have won 10 straight home games against Denver. Steve Nash, the Mavericks' No. 3 scorer, had his hands full trying to guard Van Exel and finished with only 10 points. Van Exel had his eighth game of 30 or more points this season, but it wasn't enough. Van Exel shot 12-for-29 from the field and missed six of eight 3-pointers, including the one at the end. "We came up short," Van Exel said. "I'm not happy with it, not one bit." The Mavericks appeared to be in control, taking an 84-77 lead on Najera's layup with 6:16 left to cap an 8-0 run. But Van Exel had eight points during Denver's 15-3 spurt capped by LaFrentz's basket with 1:13 remaining for a 92-87 advantage. Najera's layup and Nowitzki's 3-pointer with 33.1 left tied it at 92. "You really can't go out and play the way we did in the second half and expect to win," Mavs swingman Adrian Griffin said. "But whenever you have Steve Nash and Dirk Nowitzki, you always have a chance to win." The Mavericks were ahead 72-64 entering the final quarter. Dallas took a 52-40 halftime lead behind Howard's 12 points and seven rebounds after trailing by as many as eight in the first quarter.

Game notes
Nuggets F James Posey had a season-high 16 rebounds and Denver held a 52-37 edge on the boards. ... Denver F George McCloud missed the game with a strained right calf. ... Mavericks C Shawn Bradley took Finley's spot on the active roster, but he was not in uniform because he still is recovering from a bruised right knee. ... G-F Johnny Newman started in Finley's spot and scored eight points in 24 minutes.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
